website_summaries.verdict: A highly adaptable activity center boasting a wide variety of features that grow with your baby.
pros: Versatile design can be adjusted for use as a play mat, activity center, and activity table
11 removable toys keep babies entertained and allow for effortless customization
Rock, spin, and bounce actions help strengthen muscles while babies play
cons: Setup instructions are unclear and with so many pieces, assembly can be a little complicated

customer_reviews.title: Stages 1 and 2 are great. Stage 3 needs work
customer_reviews.text: Loved stages one and two. Baby loved the play mat and then having the familiar toys move into the exersaucer for stage two. Hours of entertainment. Really displeased with stage three. Once my baby was to tall to continue use in exersaucer mode we set it up in the "table" lay out. It's soooo wobbly, it's lead to more than it's fair share of falls and tears.
customer_reviews.author: Ipin-stuff

customer_reviews.title: Received defective product
customer_reviews.text: Shame on me for not making the return date, now I am stuck with a broken piece of junk. This exersaucer really is great, but I would not recommend buying on Amazon. Our's appeared to be previously opened and was missing pieces and one of the legs was already broken. Of course we noticed this after we started putting together (which putting this thing together is a NIGHTMARE). If you don't like or are not good at putting things together- AVOID this product.
customer_reviews.author: Christi-Bee

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This item is very grand. I am using only the bouncer version. The playtime mat gets used in the pack n play to help firm up the mattress for tummy time. I had one of the originals for my son, back in 1994. The seat bearings, the plastic and the bouncy springs do not seem of high quality, as the original. My daughter loves this item. The language “computer” was broken. I called the manufacturer. They immediately replaced it. Some of the toys require batteries but are well worth it. At the correct age, your baby will most probably love it, too!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Ali

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I used to wonder if my 4 month old needed more things to play with throughout the day...then I found this device! It quickly became her favorite play item in the house. Bouncing, balance, standing, teething, eye-hand coordination... it keeps her busy and active for about an hour at a time, a few times a day. It even folds flat for traveling. Some words of advice, the instructions SUCK. They consist of poorly written/ translated sentences and really unhelpful pictures. It took me about 45 minutes to assemble, and I consider myself pretty handy. I'd definitely recommend this Exersaucer, and my pediatrician did too. Just don't give up while assembling...your baby will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sickpup94

customer_reviews.title: The bird “flies” right off!
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this 4 stars because although it keeps my grandson busy for hours and he absolutely loves this thing.... he is able to get the bird toy off. He just shimmies it until it comes out and it’s quite big and hard that he often hurts himself with it. If they found a way to put these together so it’s not easily broken (the bird no longer stays in place at all)- I would give it 5 stars. But it is a bit of a safety issue.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Mancuso

customer_reviews.title: Great toy with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter to help her build muscle tone. Overall it's a great product, however I have a few minor things i'm not a fan of. The camera toy doesn't offer much entertainment. The bright blue light it displays when you push the button is almost too bright for the eyes. The butterfly toys that hang down aren't secured very well. The ribbon that holds them on isn't very heavy duty, it's basically silk ribbon you could buy at the store. It's starting to come apart where it's sewn to the fabric that wraps around the bar. Other then that though, our daughter loves it. We love that it collapses and makes it easier to take with us.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Nice exersaucer
customer_reviews.text: This is nice exersaucer. There is lot for baby to do and the toys are all very cute. She seemed to be entertained by all of them. It was also nice that she was able to bounce and the springs seemed to work well. I wish the seat were a little more padded and less flimsy. I also wish that when it was converted to a table top it were more stable for infant to walk along. As a table toy it tips very easily. I think if we were to do it again we would be a jumperoo though because she seemed to like to jump more than sit in the seat.
customer_reviews.author: MJJ

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son when he was around 5 months. He is now 8 months old and we are on the top notch for height and he seems to be outgrowing that. If you want something that bounces more I wouldn't suggest this. He loves to bounce but this doesn't really allow him to do that like the jumper his grandparents have. Also the butterflies that hang down just make him angry that he can't put them in his mouth. They have now been cut off. Overall it's a nice activity center he loves the music and noises from the world ball.
customer_reviews.author: Msanchez4

customer_reviews.title: Stuck seat
customer_reviews.text: Over all I like this product because there is plenty to keep the baby entertained and several of the toys make noise, music or light up. There is a lot of pieces but its pretty easy to put together and it can be twisted down for storage. My only issue with it is that the seat doesn't spin very good. It gets stuck or maybe locked into a place and cant be spun, which is why I bought this. I could be just this particular one, and all might not have the same issue. If I figure out how to fix that issue I'll update with how to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: many issues
customer_reviews.text: i don’t typically write reviews but needed to say something about this. first off, i’m pretty sure this wasn’t a brand new product (scuff marks on product right out of the box) but also the attachments that aren’t velcroed down fall off as soon as baby starts playing with them. the camera button is too hard to push for younger babies so it’s a pointless feature until he’s older and out of the bouncer. which sucks cause he likes how it lights up. the set up was insanely hard and took forever. it’s a no. i wish i went with something else
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Nice overall
customer_reviews.text: My son has been doing well with this. It keeps him active and he enjoys turning around in it. I am weary of the butterflies though. The ribbon keeping them attaching is not too strong and I can see them breaking off soon. But so far so good. Assembly was a long process & some steps in the manual are unclear but we got it all together in the end. It was a challenge but doable. I have yet to try folding it for storage. We shall see. For now it stays out and ready in the play room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is good if you have to have your baby in one ...
customer_reviews.text: It is very loud when the baby is jumping, but it has helped my baby on his legs. It is good if you have to have your baby in one place. We originally bought another less expensive one, but returned it and got this one which is much worth it. The quality and everything feels very solid. Our baby does not spend much time in it anymore since he is starting to walk, but he would grab from it and go around it, so we still have it in use after 6 months. Just have in mind that neighbors might complain because of the noise, but it will help you keep your baby in one place.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Moran

customer_reviews.title: More than just a toy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this last Christmas for our then 5 month old grandson. Our sons put it together in about 30 minutes. He loved it and was very entertained with it. He's parents enjoyed it as well being first time parents and adjusting to getting things done around the house. Our grandson is now 14 months and is enjoying stage 3. Mom says it like a whole new toy. We have another grandchild on the way. We will probably purchase sooner than later so this one can enjoy stage one.
customer_reviews.author: dagraham56

customer_reviews.title: Not A Bad Investment
customer_reviews.text: Keeps our tiny kid occupied. There's a lot to do in the saucer for the little one. Only trouble is, that alligator you see in the front? They're attached to the saucer by fabric. If you have a destructive little baby, they'll find ways of pulling them off and losing them. Pretty sure my kids going to grow up with a job with his name on his shirt. It does the job, but there are other walkers, saucers, and swings we use more over this.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: We need a NASA engineer to assemble this.
customer_reviews.text: We bought it because this one had usage beyond 2+ years. But returning it because I can't find a way to safely assemble this. Instructions are bad and my finger got hurt doing assembly.
customer_reviews.author: What?

customer_reviews.title: The wonderful thing is that it has a few stages
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased to help amuse my 5mo old son. The wonderful thing is that it has a few stages. It has n infant stage that we skipped because he was too old for it. then it has the sit in stage that has 3 adjustable heights as they grow. He can bounce in it and play with all the objects in a 360 deg rotation. After he started walking you remove the bottom base and serpentine the top unit so he can still play with it while walking all around it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pieces
customer_reviews.text: Love that this product will convert and we will be able to continue using it. Reason why I chose it. Nice vibrant colors. It is a little overwhelming when you first open it and see all the pieces. Does take some time to assemble but over all not too bad. I would’ve like for more toys to light up. Only 2 of them light up, batteries not included. My baby is going to be 4 months and is learning how to reach for toys in this. She will enjoy it more hen she learns how to jump in it I think. Good for the price compared to other ones. I’m happy with this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: My sister got this for her son who is now four, my youngest sister then used it for her baby, and now I have it for mine. Baby likes it for short periods of time. Enough to eat or do some dishes. My only complaint is that some of the toys pop out too easily so she will pull on something and it pops out and it’s her in the face or when it’s set up as the s shaped part they are leaning on a toy and it pops out and down baby goes. I wish we could replace the toys maybe then they would stay in.
customer_reviews.author: Megan A.

customer_reviews.title: A little pricier than the $40-50 centers, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great activity center. I feel bad for parent's not mechanically inclined as it's not a simply assembly process, but there are plenty of videos out there on YouTube to help. My fiancee looked at all the pieces and said "no way!". lol My butterflies were put on backwards and the ribbon is much longer than in the pictures so they hit the birds below. There are two screws on each butterfly so you can reverse and shorten the ribbon. My 8 month old took all of 5 mins to get her bearings in it and is now bouncing around, spinning and touching/mouthing everything. Even trying to do pull ups on the "monkey bar"
customer_reviews.author: Alkemyst

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining toy
customer_reviews.text: You need a degree from MIT to put this together but when you do, it's a great toy for the baby. Fun sounds, great colors and lots of doodads all over. She loves being in it and it gives me a minute to step away and comic book movie trailers while she's playing with the crocodile.
customer_reviews.author: adam kazansky

customer_reviews.title: Best of its kind
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great toy for all stages. If parents have to pay such a high price for development-helping toys then we might as well get them all in one if we can! I like that baby can spin all the way around in this and that there are a lot of toys that make sounds to keep her entertained and engaged. It's really nice that this grows with her through the first year. It promotes neck, leg and "trunk" stability while helping to develop motor skills with touching the toys and them reacting to her touch. It's great exposure for learning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazon shipped in original box from Evenflo.  Box was beat up and ripped upon arrival!
customer_reviews.text: Our twin grandchildren do enjoy this toy. Bought some replacement toys immediately from Evenflo. Not as interesting as the World Explorer until Grampa replaced some of the toys and added a mirror! Very sturdy even when they bounce hard in it. Poorly shipped in original box from Evenflo. All pieces were accounted for though! Thanks C/W
customer_reviews.author: C/W

customer_reviews.title: A must have for babies and toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this saucer! We had one for my older son (now 6) and I saw so excited to find it again. Putting it together can be a little daunting at first. My son loves to sit and bounce. The main reason I love this saucer is that it converts to a standing toy once the child is too big for just sitting in a seat. A great value and buy!
customer_reviews.author: Len W.

customer_reviews.title: This exersaucer is nice. My daughter liked the intermediate stage
customer_reviews.text: This exersaucer is nice. My daughter liked the intermediate stage, sitting in it and playing long periods on her own. Now we have it in the last stage, to help her start cruising, and I wouldn't lable it as "stable." There are times I think it's going to fall over. But it does break down nicely and store easily. Definitely a huge plus. I can't wait to use it with the next baby. 4 stars because the last stage isn't as stable as I wish it was.
customer_reviews.author: Lesli Ross

customer_reviews.title: This exersaucer is a wonderful product, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This exersaucer is a wonderful product, worth every penny! My husband and I wanted something for our daughter that would grow with her through each stage in her infancy, so-to-speak, and this is one of the only products that has this capability. There are several parts that need to be assembled, but the directions are clear and concise, which allow for minimal stress. Our daughter loves bouncing in the exersaucer and we thoroughly enjoy the excitement she feels, even the various jungle sounds that play during her time in the item. Excellent product quality for the price. Yes I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality.
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves this exersaucer, but I'm very disappointed by the quality of the toy--she has used this for just over a month, and she was very quickly able to break one of the toy pieces (with mild use). She is not the strongest baby, yet she was able to pull out the Toucan on a branch piece within the first two weeks of using it! It appeared that the connection between the toy and the exersaucer was faulty and so just tugging on that part was enough to yank it out of the exersaucer unit. The exersaucer otherwise works well, but I am disappointed by the overall quality of the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie M.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love the product, however be aware of the alligator and other toys. They easily scratch off and child can get the color it the mouth. My baby love all the activity but i dont like how you can scratch and paint comes off toys.
customer_reviews.author: Lady shiva

customer_reviews.title: Like but it's okay
customer_reviews.text: My baby likes it but does get bored after 10-15 minutes. It needs more buttons, light-up things and music. She can't reach the butterflies and the camera is just okay, they need better entertaining things on here. Especially for the price, I would expect something more entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: A couple of issues
customer_reviews.text: I had read and seen great reviews on this exersaucer, but there were a couple of issues that I don't like. First, I was surprised at how many parts there were to put the exersaucer together. And was a bit difficult with all the springs and such. I do like that there are a lot of toys and activities, but the second issue is that the hummingbird and the other bird that sits on a branch are so easy to take out. My 6 month old is already taking them out by herself and she is not that strong. Just something to consider when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Walter E Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality shipping box.
customer_reviews.text: Our twin grandchildren love this one and also the Triple Fun Active Learning one. Four stars versus five for the packaging. Shipped in original box that Evenflo provided. Cardboard was paper thin. Multiple tears and holes in box. Amazing all pieces were their. UPS beat up poor box very badly! Thanks C/W
customer_reviews.author: C/W

customer_reviews.title: Good option if you’re looking for a more natural theme
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect little safety exersaucer! It has really ‘organic’ sounds- which was important to us. A lot of toys are too sing-song, this has a couple little songs and jungle noises. It is a little bigger & plastic- but almost all baby things are. We’ve used this for ~6 months so far, which is also impressive because they’re growing so rapidly in the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Genesis H.

customer_reviews.title: great bouncer
customer_reviews.text: This toy is awesome. It comes apart for 3 stages. We used the play bar for my son in his pack n play as a newborn. He moved to the bouncer bit around 3 months and now at 8 months and standing, we have it in the S shape for standing play. The only thing that bums me out about this is that the bird and dragonfly toys aren't secured very well. My son can pull them out and throw them or hit them on things. I mean, hey if he enjoys himself its fine, but it was a little scary in the beginning when he didnt understand that he could hurt himself.
customer_reviews.author: Ayla

customer_reviews.title: Must have for busy moms
customer_reviews.text: Tons of stuff to keep baby entertained. The noises aren’t too distracting or irritating to listen to all day. It held up well and we were able to pass it on when we were done with it.

customer_reviews.title: Great 3 in 1 product.
customer_reviews.text: By the time I bought this my daughter had less interest in the floor mat. She's currently 6 months and loves the exersaucer. She spins around 360 degrees easily on her own, she loves to grab all the toys and press all the buttons. She loves that they light up. I wish that it had more educational opportunities. Only the crocodile toy has numbers and shapes on the bottom and it just plays music when you match them correctly. I bought this because it's an Amazon theme, and I got exactly what was advertised so for that I give it 5 stars. If I really wanted more educational components I could have bought a different exersaucer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good exersaucer. My little one pulled the butterflys off pretty quickly and the tree comes out very easily but otherwise it was very entertaining for him. He used it from 6 months till about 1 year. I found it difficult to clean up against all the toys.
customer_reviews.author: Sloth Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love this exersaucer
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this toy. There's a lot of activities and it's well made. She's a tiny thing and it still accommodates her just fine. It's also got good support for little ones that are just beginning to be able to sit up a bit, my granddaughter was barely 4 months old when we started putting her in it. It's expensive for the amount of time it will be used, but if taken well care of, you should be able to get most of the money back from reselling it.
customer_reviews.author: VAS

customer_reviews.title: Super cute, favorite bouncer.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. My son only used the bouncer part for probably 6 months before he got tired of it but he used the hell out of it and loved it. Great thing is you can take the toys off and they can play with them still.
customer_reviews.author: Fabiana Forteau

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't the miracle play toy that I hoped it would be, but my 6 month old is mildly entertained for 15 min or so. Most of the toys are pretty lame- she ignores the monkeys and the hanging butterflies. The three birds at the back don't do anything at all. the alligator part is fun, but once she knocks the pieces off, there's nothing left to play with. I read up and thought this was the best one, but I wish we had just gotten a cheap jumper and then some better toys to play with separately. This thing is heinous looking and huge.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loved it! He still does. However when it’s time to take apart and turn into the activity table it is not sturdy at all. My son kept pulling it over on himself so I had to turn it back into the exersaucer 😩
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Endless hours of rain Forrest exploration for years to come.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful investment & endless hours of exploration of shapes, forms, sounds & colors. I bought it as a gift for my 5-month old grandson and he's really enjoying himself when in his Rain Forrest. Shipping & delivery was super fast. The package literally contained 100+ pieces so assembly IS required. But it's totally worth the effort and the little man LOVES his toys. As he moves around, the chair moves around with him. It's very energy consuming for a 5-month baby so in the beginning, he could only take 20-30 minutes of exploration. This is an absolute favorite among his toys and I highly recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Stenmark

customer_reviews.title: Jump, jump, jump.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves this activity center. Any time she's fussing or border I'll stick her in the jumper and she'll quiet down and get to work. Assembly took about 45 minutes. You will need to read the instructions (I tried without and failed) but they are clear and everything pretty much will only fit into one place. I like that some of the stations have two sound settings. It's a good variety of toys and holds my daughters attention. She's been using it for over 3 months and it's help us well and held her attention.
customer_reviews.author: chetholt

customer_reviews.title: Not easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this table. She has one at daycare. However putting together is awful. We bought it for the stage 3 function and putting it together to that stage was not easy. We had to YouTube it on Christmas Eve. It’s a little not sturdy but my daughter still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ANASTASIA BOWEN

customer_reviews.title: A fine exersaucer
customer_reviews.text: the exersaucer is fine. So far we have only used it as an exersaucer and have not made it into the toddler table. The range of toys is nice but the globe has "ABC" on it, so I thought it would do more with letters but it only makes animal sounds and plays music. Also, the alligator has the numbers 1, 2, 3. Again, I thought it would count or say numbers but it makes music. I wish there were more activities that actually grew with the child.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: I love this. My son is 5 months and we just converted it to the exersaucer from the floor mat. There is so much to see and do and there are no annoying sounds!!! I love it; although, as my son grows, he may want annoying noises at some point! Everything is in decent proximity to the seat so he can reach even at his age. He is amused in their for a half hour at a time, which is pretty good. I'm not entirely certain it was worth the price as I haven't sampled cheaper options, but I can say, we love it and love having an all in one toy. I hate clutter...
customer_reviews.author: Mzindira

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem suitable for 5 month old
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 month old grandson. We needed something he could sit up in and play for a little while. He sat in it fine. But the toys were hard plastic and he couldn't reach them to chew on. The toys that made noise were too hard for him to push down on and make the noise. I even had a hard time with that. We took it apart and may try again in a month or so. I would have sent it back but we had already put the box out for recycling.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves playing in her exersaucer. It's been great for her development. A lot for her to work on her hand/eye coordination. The musical toys aren't annoying either. Some of the toys can be interchanged with the other themes, which has been great for keeping it fun and new for her. Have one at each of her grandparent's house.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Zehr

customer_reviews.title: Great but a bear to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars but be forewarned it is a bear to put together. It is fun, moves well, adapts to age, and looks great but it comes in a dizzying amount of pieces. I spent hours, now I was without real help (my 8 year old helped lol), so take that into account. Maybe two adults could have had less trouble. I found the instructions a bit poorly written but that is a minor gripe not worth a loss of a star. Overall I m happy with its function and looks. Happy buying
customer_reviews.author: Bradly Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our little girl loves this thing. Seems pretty durable and has lots of fun toys on it. They also have off switches which is great. Wasnt too hard to assemble, took about 30 min and you need a screwdriver with #1 and #2 phillips head bits. Best part of it is the versatility. This will last through many different stages.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Darden

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was 3 months old when we first got this. We never used the playmat, we just let her use the exersaucer. She was a little small so we pushed blankets in the whole with her to help her fit. She absolutely loves it! She loves that she can turn herself and play with multiple different things and the many different noises and multiple toys that she can play with. This was a little on the pricy side by so so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Maddy I.

customer_reviews.title: Babies either love or hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: Babies either love or hate this thing; you just never know. Kind of pricey, so try to find one used if you can. They only use it for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves it! Keeps her entertained until she tires out!
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This monster is very entertaining. As expected, it takes a little time to piece it together. The one thing I don't like about it is the folding legs. This thing is so big that it is impractical to fold and carry with you and it doesn't fold well enough to store anywhere. So the folding legs are kind of a waste because it seems less stable (not safety wise) than if it had permanent locking legs. All that said, my 6 month old son loves this and spins around to take advantage of all the features.
customer_reviews.author: H. pullen

customer_reviews.title: Chip paint
customer_reviews.text: Other then the parot/bird white paint chipping off which is a disappointment. I think my son happy being in the bouncer. Can I have a replacement bird that paints does not chip or do I need to return the while thing? Guess I will see if they will reply to me or I will have to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great saucer!
customer_reviews.text: Great saucer! Both my Kids loved it and we bought one for a friend who also loved it. My only issue is a couple of the toys’ paint comes off when bitten (my kids put everything in their mouth).
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: So fun
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun toy for kiddos. I put this together without my husbands help and it took a while BUT I was able to do it. It has a lot of pieces to assemble but is worth it. Our daughter loves playing in it.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Schultz

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: The product needs more entertainment of sounds. Also sounds coming from all over exer saucer, not just the same few buttons. My babe seems to lose interest in it quicker than other things
customer_reviews.author: golfergirl

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a Jumperoo in its place and believe it was a better choice. It is less bulky
customer_reviews.text: Returned. The product looked used when I received it. I purchased a Jumperoo in its place and believe it was a better choice. It is less bulky.
customer_reviews.author: BSP

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: There was a missing part that did not allow the seat to turn 360 degrees. My baby gets frustrated since the product does not work as advertised. Reached out to the seller about the defect and never received a response. Very disappointed and now we need to buy another activity center for our baby.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy about that at all
customer_reviews.text: Well I have already written a review and haven't heard back from anyone. My rating would certainly be much higher if I would have received a response to my problem. When I received the product, it was missing a part. Not a toy or a part that was of no consequence to the structure of the Exersaucer, but one of the brown pieces of one of the legs. You definitely had to have it to complete the construction of the product. But, no response. Not too happy about that at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Cooney

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this until he became a walker - then he wanted nothing to do with it - which makes sense. It does take up quite a bit of space but it's great to plop the baby in when you need 15 minutes to get something done and he's crawling all over the place. Lots of activities to entertain him. He even liked it when he was walking as long as he was on the OUTSIDE...lol
customer_reviews.author: Booklover99

customer_reviews.title: Super fun saucer
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome exersaucer. Keeps this 7 mo old baby comfy and occupied. She loves all the activities and learned very quickly how to turn herself toward the toy she wanted to play with. The well shaped seat supports her in all the right places. Love the saucer on the bottom so her feet stay clean. Makes cute sounds too. Easy to wipe it clean. I could go on and on...
customer_reviews.author: Smp

customer_reviews.title: Not like other Exersaucers
customer_reviews.text: This was very disappointing. I've owned a few different Exersaucers over the years and loved them all. EXCEPT this one. The fabric seat came with NO padding, so baby could probably get bruised ribs from it. Also, several of the toy attachments fall out when barely touched. WORSTE baby product I've seen in a while, and that's saying a lot since I've had 6 kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Emily J Peterson

customer_reviews.title: and now she can happily entertain herself while I get a few things done
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loooooooves this exersaucer, and it has been such a lifesaver! She is at the age where she wants to stand but can't actually stand by herself yet, and now she can happily entertain herself while I get a few things done. She laughs and jumps and plays and spins.... I do wish there were a few more music options, but the music/sounds are very pleasant. The "Amazon"/explorer theme is very cute (if not 100% accurate...a zebra in the Amazon?? Whaaa? haha). Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: but he gets pretty bored with the other toys
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the swinging butterflies, but he gets pretty bored with the other toys. He is most excited by the flashing blue light on the camera. The birds have 3 different actions, but baby isn't impressed by any of them (the roller spins and you can't even tell that it is spinning).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for my grandson who is 7 months old. It has turned out to be a great gift. There were too many toys that overwhelmed him, but we took half of them off and he was better with it. It is a big toy...but worth the space it takes up. It's also a bit noisy when they jump. But if mommy is busy cooking supper, she can put him in it in the kitchen and know right where he is... :-)
customer_reviews.author: Erin B

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: My son was able to start using this around for months, he's about average size in both height and weight (double). He LOVES this, the alagator and globe are his favorite, everything besides the monkeys, butterflies and the birds takes triple A batteries so be prepared for tha because they don't come with it. It's a rocker,jumper and spinner and he loves it. He goes crazy bouncing in this thing, hes about 8 months old now and still getting a kick out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: it assembles easy enough and the music is ok
customer_reviews.text: it assembles easy enough and the music is ok. what my 5 month old does though is completely pull out the parrot or the butterfly thingies, and drops them into where he is sitting or sometimes on the floor. I wish the low volumes could be even lower, the low settings are too loud. my little guy is frustrated when the alligator parts are out of his reach-this will change as he grows. I chose this over a more musical saucer because of a pinching hazard with the other option. hope I made the right choice
customer_reviews.author: milo's mama

customer_reviews.title: Our little one likes it daily.
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves and hates this, but over all she likes it. She has a short attention span so we get about 10-20 minutes of play out of it a day. Helps her with standing so we cannot complain. We plan to use the stand up shape once she is able to use that function.
customer_reviews.author: R. SHIOTA

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a little one
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves this, and enjoys bouncing around. Does require 7 AAA batteries, and an engineering degree would have been helpful in put this together. We do like that it can be moved up for her as she gets taller and it can be used for when she walks.
customer_reviews.author: Roo99Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: ... HARD plastic and my kid throws his head around like crazy. I have to put a thick blanket ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat is made of HARD plastic and my kid throws his head around like crazy. I have to put a thick blanket over it to cover the back so my child doesn't whack his head... It is neat, but doesn't meet my expectations, as it seems a little "cheap" if you will because of all the hard plastic. He loves the music it plays though. and it doesn't bounce much AT ALL.. Meh. I wouldn't buy it again from my other options that I was looking at...
customer_reviews.author: Sara Le

customer_reviews.title: I like it and my son does as well
customer_reviews.text: I like it and my son does as well. I like that there are not alot of flashing lights or super loud contious noises. There are more things that he can play and move around hiself so its not overwhelmingly loud or over stimulating. The music is super cute and goes well with the theme.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent learning tool.
customer_reviews.text: Great stages toy, provides for several months of use to keep them entertained and focused.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but be prepared to work for that awesomeness! 😆
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and would give five stars except it was the LEAST ASSEMBLED product I’ve ever bought!!! SO MANY PIECES! Tools are required! And apparently every little gadget on it requires many batteries and it includes ZERO batteries! 🤷🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ann Thompson

customer_reviews.title: LOVE TO LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best Exersaucer toy out there. The activities and sounds are amazing, there is such bright colors and varieties, and the fact that you can buy it for a new born and it can grow with you to the toddler stage is more than reason enough to spend the extra money to buy it. If you want quality, sensory motor stimulation and greatness, please buy it! It's a wonderful toy, the quality is amazing, it's worth every penny!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Merryman

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My 16 week old son loves the floor mat. He is too big to sit in the activity center right now. Make sure to get lots of batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Leisha Kivlehan

customer_reviews.title: overall great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the triple fun jungle theme one. Love it. baby's happy. the color is slightly different from shown. Thought it would be the tone-down green color as in the pic, but in person, it is just as bright green color as other baby items are. not that it is bad..but wanted to take some break from those blindingly bright colors. No biggie for me, but if the color shown in the pic is THE MAIN reason you chose this item, you'd be surprised. Some of the customer pictures will give you better idea.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to buy plenty of batteries. So fun.
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to assemble so be prepared with patience and instructions. Our grand baby loves this whole it also helps strengthen her legs and torso. It is fun for adults to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Meyers

customer_reviews.title: If you buy one big toy for your child, this is it!
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this! He's 4 months old and I wish we had gotten this months ago! He loves all the little toys on it, especially the globe. The monkeys that slide along the bar frustrate him because he can't slide them up very far, but we just divert his attention to a different toy when he gets too frustrated. This definitely keeps him occupied enough for me to get some things done around the house. Hoping we can get at least a couple years of use out of this, and who knows...maybe in a few years we might be able to use it for our next child as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca S

customer_reviews.title: Love This!!
customer_reviews.text: The little one loves this and its even better that it can grow as he does!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to grow with
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 month old. He is now 6 months and plays in it every day and loves it. It keeps him entertained as long as he's in the mood to play. The reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 is because my son has been able to pull the bird and Dragon fly out since day one. I had to super glue them down.
customer_reviews.author: JediJess

customer_reviews.title: Read your instruction twice.
customer_reviews.text: She loves her sit spin. Looks great wish I had stuff like this available when I was a baby.
customer_reviews.author: MiraJaneSheDevil

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR BABY
customer_reviews.text: Great design, baby can stand or sit and has a wide variety of toys of different shapes and configurations including a music box that plays in different languages. Keeps baby occupied and stimulates the mind and small muscles. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lee

customer_reviews.title: More sounds please!
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves his ExerSaucer! He's put all the different toys in his mouth at least once. His favorite is the hanging panda bear 🐼... I give it 4 stars because I wish it would have more music/sound effects.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Little ones love it
customer_reviews.text: The little ones love it. It is like a new discovery each time they sit in it. Easy to put together - it took me about 20-30 minutes. It is helpful if you organize all the pieces in front of you so that you are not constantly searching for pieces. It is great that this grows with the kids so they will still play with this once they outgrow the sitting part of it. Just don't lose the instruction manual for when you want to open it up. It has two spare pieces for once the kids outgrow the saucer aspect of this. The parts store under the table, but they do fall off from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: David Savitz

customer_reviews.title: Safe happy and busy
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! My granddaughter loves this! Wish I had purchased it a month ago. The colors are bright. The activities are engaging, and I love the adjustable height. The saucer design is stable and safe, moving just enough to give her the activity of exercising her legs and back. This will definetly keep her busy and happy and safe
customer_reviews.author: Kats calls

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Our 8 month old started using this at 4 months and loves it. It took a couple of days for her to get used to it, but now we can put her in it while we're busy with something and she'll play for 20 min, which is great with a super active 8 month old!
customer_reviews.author: C. Paige

customer_reviews.title: Do the baby a favor, get this.
customer_reviews.text: Of all the different stuff you can buy for a baby to stay entertained, this should top the list. We had an exersaucer for our daughter so when she had her little one, what better? These things are awesome! Grandbaby stays content and is always trying to figure out all the different toys and sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I just wish that it was easier to convert it into the toddler table. I still haven't figured out how and it's not stable.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria P.

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun play station! I just wish that the 3 animals under the back curved piece did something more than one having a spinner on it. I love that my grandson can use this through toddler hood because it comes apart and becomes an "S" shaped play station! My grandson is 6 months old and he has spent 90 minutes in it having a blast!! The assembly took me about 90 minutes and for the most part it went well.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie G

customer_reviews.title: The table wobbles and gets knocked over easily. I had to secure the tabe to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally gave this 4 stars but after setting it up as a activity table the product just became unsafe. The table wobbles and gets knocked over easily. I had to secure the tabe to a piece of plywood to make it safe. Keeping this thing clean is a nightmare. The bird doesn't stay in for nothing. And when my child would full on bounce the thing is so loud. It's a good bouncer but stages 1 and 3 are useless...
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and not too big
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 month old grandson. My daughter lives in a smaller home and I was worried about the size but this has been perfect. My grandson loves all of the different activities and he loves spending time in the Exersaucer. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love all the attractions on it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson who is 5 months and weighs 20 plus pounds. He is a big boy. He is very active. This bouncer has saved my life. I put him in this when I can't hold him and he loves it, he will sit in it for 30 min. plus. I love all the attractions on it.It keeps him entertained. It is very sturdy and it will last till my other granddaughter can get in it.
customer_reviews.author: mommaslater90

customer_reviews.title: some of the musical sounds actually have a pretty good beat
customer_reviews.text: We bought this when the baby was about 4 months old and he has played in it just about every day since then (he is now 6.5 months old). He continues to be entertained and contained by it. We have found that the noises it makes are surprisingly tolerable, some of the musical sounds actually have a pretty good beat. We have the jungle version - I'm not sure what the noises are like for the other themes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: some pieces are loose.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works perfect on this, I don't like the fact that it was so hard to put together.. A few pieces kept falling off. They are not secure. So I'm not extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Rissa

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this item at 4pm and received the package ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item at 4pm and received the package the next day. This is a lifesaver for busy moms. My son is tall and big for a 6 month and he is at the highest notch already! As per instruction, child should be at tippie toe - i'd say he has another week to be able to use this which is a bummer. If not for the convertible option to a table type and removable toys, i would've returned this.
customer_reviews.author: ayan

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and practical
customer_reviews.text: Fun to watch baby go through his stages and excel through the various levels of this saucer
customer_reviews.author: Lara T

customer_reviews.title: The command center
customer_reviews.text: Oh my awesome! Our little one loves this! it was easy to assemble alone, easy to clean and sheer pleasure to watch your little one jump. My only complaint is the Velcro to strap the accessories on. I don't think the straps as very effective and wish it would hold them a little tighter. I was impressed that the toys also doubled as teether toys with different textures and shapes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wessel

customer_reviews.title: Can't keep him away
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves the exersaucer. It has helped his core muscles, can entertain him for quite a while and seems to be comfortable for him. It's also a great way to get some of his energy out while we eat dinner. The one only down side we have seen is that some of the pieces, like the mirror, bend back then spring forward. We are worried about him getting smacked in the face if he lets it go after bending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah L

customer_reviews.title: My son loved this from the time we first put him in ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this from the time we first put him in it. He's 14 months now and we still have it in our living room because he still likes to play with it but not be in it. He stands and walks around the outside of it now playing with all the different sides. It was also fun watching him grow into this(and out of this) and evolve to each of the different levels.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey M

customer_reviews.title: its a great product as long as you keep it as and ...
customer_reviews.text: its a great product as long as you keep it as and exersaucer, once you transform it into the play table not so friendly.
customer_reviews.author: KM

product_meta.title: Evenflo Exersaucer Triple Fun Active Learning Center, Life in the Amazon
product_meta.description: Color:Life in the AmazonDELIVERY ALERT: This item ships in its original packaging and may be visible upon delivery! Evenflo ExerSaucer Triple Fun - Life in the Amazon Exercises Body and Mind The Evenflo ExerSaucer TripleFun Amazon by offers parents a "safe alternative" to walkers. With a variety of age-appropriate toys that help your baby achieve important developmental milestones. With rock, spin and bounce actions that provide your baby with plenty of exercise to strengthen legs, back and neck muscles. Offering parents extended use with three stages of use and easy conversion, your baby can use this product to learn and play from newborn to 24 months! Product Dimensions: 31.5 x 30 x 30 inches Weight: 22.5 pounds . Plastic Parts -Wipe surface clean with cloth slightly moistened with mild soap and water. Allow to air dry. Seat Pad -Machine Wash Separately, Cold Water – Delicate Cycle. No chlorine bleach. Tumble Dry: 10 – 15 Minutes on Low Heat – Remove Immediately.
feature_bullets: Playmat, exersaucer and activity table in one unit provides for extended usage as your child grows
Portability folds significantly smaller that makes travel and storage easy
11 age-appropriate toys and fun music help baby achieve 10 developmental milestones such as fine motor skills, object exploration, tactile development and more
3-position height adjustment grows with baby seat locks in multiple positions
Note: Item do not contain iguana
Playmat, exersaucer and activity table in one unit provides for extended USAge as your child grows
Portability folds significantly smaller that makes travel and storage easy
11 age-appropriate toys and fun music help baby achieve 10 developmental milestones such as fine motor skills, object exploration, tactile development and more
3-position height adjustment grows with baby seat locks in multiple positions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,097 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
